solution_line_template: If the ratio of boys to girls in the math class is {boys_ratio_part}:{girls_ratio_part}, the total ratio of the number of boys and girls in the math class is {boys_ratio_part}+{girls_ratio_part} = <<{boys_ratio_part}+{girls_ratio_part}={total_ratio_parts}>>{total_ratio_parts}.

The fraction that represents the number of boys in the class is {boys_fraction}, and since there are {total_students} students in the class, the number of boys in the class is {boys_fraction}*{total_students} = <<{boys_fraction}*{total_students}={num_boys}>>{num_boys}.
The number of girls in the class is {total_students}-{num_boys} = <<{total_students}-{num_boys}={num_girls}>>{num_girls}.
